location: E58 highway, west of Bezimenne, Novoazovsk Raion, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine

evidence.analysis: The video of the tank explosion was captured by journalists from the Chinese channel Phoenix TV on May 6, 2022. [2, 3] Multiple reports confirm the event, with one analysis geolocating the site of the attack to near Novoazovsk, a town deep within the self-proclaimed "Donetsk People's Republic" and approximately 13 km from the Russian border. [1] Another report from a Czech news outlet also features a segment titled "Video: Explosion of a Russian tank. Chinese television filmed it far from the front," corroborating the source of the footage. [4]

The dashcam footage shows the vehicle traveling east on a two-lane road that curves gently to the right. [1, 3] This matches the orientation and layout of the E58 highway seen in the satellite reference image. [5]

Visible on the right (south) side of the road in the video stills is a distinctive white concrete fence and a single-story building with a dark roof. [1, 3] These structures are clearly identifiable in the satellite imagery at the specified coordinates, confirming the location. [5]

The satellite image shows a dirt road intersecting the main E58 highway from the south, just west of the building complex. [5] This intersection is visible on the right side of the dashcam view, further corroborating the location. [1]

Lines of trees are present on both sides of the road in the footage, and a utility pole can be seen on the right shoulder. [1, 3] This arrangement of vegetation and infrastructure is consistent with the features visible in the satellite view of the area. [5]
